snippet: A Bronx man has pleaded guilty to a federal charge and could face up to five years in prison for aiming a laser pointer at planes near a Queens airport.
abstract: Bronx man Elehecer Balaguer, who has history of psychological issues and convictions for dealing drugs, pleads guilty to shining laser pointer at planes headed for La Guardia Airport; Balaguer had previously admitted, during trial of Frank J Egan, that he had been sole perpetrator; faces up to five years in prison on federal charges.
lead_paragraph: A Bronx man has pleaded guilty to a federal charge and could face up to five years in prison for aiming a laser pointer at planes near a Queens airport.

headline.main: Bronx Man Admits Aiming Laser at Planes near La Guardia Airport
headline.print_headline: Man Admits to Aiming a Laser at Airplanes Near La Guardia

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Laser (Light Amplification by Stimulated Emission of Radiation)
